atherosclerosis (fatty deposits in blood vessels) by damaging the lining of arteries and promoting blood clots. 
However, a causal link has not yet been established [136]. Homocysteine levels are influenced by both genetic 
and dietary folic acid, vitamins B6 and B12 and higher circulating vitamin concentrations relate to lower 
concentrations of homocysteine [136].
